quiz.title: AP Calculus AB/BC: Optimization & Related Rates Quiz
quiz.subtitle: Unit 5 & 4 Review: Real-World Applications (10 Problems)
quiz.subject: AP Calculus

questions.question: A cylindrical can with both top and bottom must contain exactly 500 cm³ of liquid. If the can has radius r cm and height h cm, which relationship between h and r minimizes the surface area (and thus material used)?
questions.explanation: Volume constraint: πr²h = 500 → h = 500/(πr²). Surface area S = 2πr² + 2πrh = 2πr² + 1000/r. Minimize: S'(r) = 4πr - 1000/r² = 0 → 4πr³ = 1000 → r³ = 250/π → h = 500/(πr²) = 2r.

questions.question: A rectangular poster must contain 50 in² of printed material. Margins are 2 inches at top and bottom, and 1 inch on each side. If w is the width of the printed area, which value of w minimizes the total area of the poster?
questions.explanation: Printed height h = 50/w. Poster dimensions: width = w + 2 (1″ each side), height = h + 4 (2″ top + 2″ bottom). Total area A = (w+2)(50/w + 4) = 98 + 2w + 96/w. A'(w) = 2 - 96/w² = 0 → w² = 48 → w = 4√3 ≈ 6.93? Wait — recalc: Actually A(w) = (w+2)(50/w+4) = 50 + 4w + 100/w + 8 = 58 + 4w + 100/w. A'(w) = 4 - 100/w² = 0 → w² = 25 → w = 5 inches. My earlier simplification had an error; corrected here.

questions.question: A 10-foot ladder leans against a vertical wall. The bottom of the ladder slides away from the wall horizontally at a constant rate of 1 ft/s. When the bottom is 6 feet from the wall, how fast is the top of the ladder sliding down the wall?
questions.explanation: Let x = distance from wall to ladder bottom, y = height of ladder top. x² + y² = 100. Differentiate: 2x(dx/dt) + 2y(dy/dt) = 0. Given dx/dt = 1, at x = 6: y = √(100-36) = 8. So 6(1) + 8(dy/dt) = 0 → dy/dt = -6/8 = -0.75 ft/s (negative indicates downward).

questions.question: Find two positive numbers whose product is 100 and whose sum is as small as possible.
questions.explanation: Let numbers be x and y, with xy = 100 → y = 100/x. Sum S = x + 100/x. S'(x) = 1 - 100/x² = 0 → x² = 100 → x = 10 (positive). Then y = 10. Check second derivative: S''(x) = 200/x³ > 0, so minimum.

questions.question: A particle moves along the curve y = √x. When it passes through the point (4,2), its x-coordinate increases at 3 cm/s. How fast is its distance from the origin changing at that instant?
questions.explanation: Distance to origin: r² = x² + y² = x² + x (since y² = x). Differentiate: 2r(dr/dt) = 2x(dx/dt) + dx/dt. At (4,2): r = √(16+4) = √20 = 2√5, dx/dt = 3. So 4√5(dr/dt) = 2(4)(3) + 3 = 24 + 3 = 27 → dr/dt = 27/(4√5) = (27√5)/20.

questions.question: A man launches a boat from point A on the north bank of a straight river 3 km wide. He wants to reach point B, 8 km downstream on the south bank, as quickly as possible. He can row at 6 km/h and run at 8 km/h. He plans to row to a point on the south bank x km downstream from A, then run the rest. What x minimizes total time?
questions.explanation: Rowing distance = √(9 + x²) km, time = √(9+x²)/6 hours. Running distance = (8-x) km, time = (8-x)/8 hours. Total T(x) = √(9+x²)/6 + (8-x)/8. T'(x) = x/(6√(9+x²)) - 1/8 = 0 → 8x = 6√(9+x²) → 64x² = 36(9+x²) → 28x² = 324 → x² = 81/7 → x = 9/√7 km.

questions.question: Find the coordinates of the point on the line y = 4x + 7 that is closest to the origin.

An inverted conical tank has height 6 m and top radius 2 m. Water leaks out at 0.01 m³/min while being pumped in at a constant rate. When the water depth is 2 m, the water level rises at 0.2 m/min. Approximately what is the pump's rate in liters per minute? (1 m³ = 1000 L)
questions.explanation: By similar triangles, radius r at height h: r/h = 2/6 → r = h/3. Volume V = (π/3)r²h = (π/27)h³. dV/dt = (π/9)h²(dh/dt). At h=2: dV/dt = (π/9)(4)(0.2) = 0.8π/9 ≈ 0.2793 m³/min. Net rate = pump rate - 0.01 = 0.2793 → pump rate ≈ 0.2893 m³/min = 289.3 L/min.

questions.question: An open-top box with a square base must have volume 32,000 cm³. Find the side length of the base that minimizes the surface area (base + 4 sides).
questions.explanation: Let base side = x cm, height = h cm. Volume: x²h = 32000 → h = 32000/x². Surface area S = x² (base) + 4xh (sides) = x² + 128000/x. S'(x) = 2x - 128000/x² = 0 → 2x³ = 128000 → x³ = 64000 → x = 40 cm.

questions.question: A spotlight on the ground shines on a wall 12 m away. A man 2 m tall walks from the spotlight toward the wall at 1.5 m/s. When he is 4 m from the wall, how fast is the height of his shadow on the wall decreasing?
questions.explanation: Let x = distance from spotlight to man. By similar triangles: shadow height y satisfies 2/x = y/12 → y = 24/x. Differentiate: dy/dt = -24/x² (dx/dt). When man is 4 m from wall, he is 8 m from spotlight (x=8), and dx/dt = 1.5 (positive toward wall). So dy/dt = -24/64 × 1.5 = -0.5625 m/s (negative means decreasing).
